thread.title: Nathan van Berlo still has a future at West Lakes, says coach Scott Camporeale | The
thread.title_full: Nathan van Berlo still has a future at West Lakes, says coach Scott Camporeale | The Advertiser

author: Andrew Capel
title: Nathan van Berlo still has a future at West Lakes, says coach Scott Camporeale | The
text:
INTERIM coach Scott Camporeale says dumped former skipper Nathan van Berlo still has a future at the Adelaide Football Club.
Van Berlo, 29, has been dropped for Sunday’s Showdown 39 against Port Adelaide at Adelaide Oval and Camporeale insists it is for form reasons only and not about pushing an older player out the door.
He said van Berlo had been sent back to the SANFL “to work on a couple of things” and tipped him to quickly regain his spot in the AFL side.
“There are no (long term) issues with Nathan,” Camporeale said today.
“Nathan is coming off a long term injury (a ruptured Achilles which cost him the 2014 season), he’s missed a lot of footy and sometimes there can be issues with some consistency and getting back into form.
Special Walsh Medal for Showdown 39
Start of sidebar. Skip to end of sidebar.
Recommended Coverage ASC lets 101 workers go at Osborne ONE hundred and one workers have been let go from Osborne shipbuilders ASC this morning as the so-called Valley of Death continues to deepen. Murder mystery: Child’s remains dumped in suitcase UPDATE: Autopsy results on the remains of a murdered child found dumped in a suitcase in the Murray Mallee are expected to be released today. First-rate perks for council staff ADELAIDE City Council staff can book accommodation costing up to $250 a night anywhere in Australia under a travel allowance more generous than that offered to state government or tax office workers. End of sidebar. Return to start of sidebar.
“Twelve months out of the game is a long time and even by his own admission he’s not playing the way he’d like to play. Nathan van Berlo handballs against West Coast. Source: Getty Images
“So he’s just going to go back and play in the SANFL.
“He’s got a couple of things with a really clear focus that he’s going to work in but his leadership has been outstanding through this whole (Phil Walsh) period and the whole year and he’s going to be really valuable for us in the weeks coming, that’s for sure.
“Some of the stuff that he’s done has been really good, it’s just more the consistency of it and the fact that we need more from him.
“He’s really important to our make up but we just need more from him in that two hours (on game day).”
Camporeale said van Berlo was naturally disappointed at being dumped for such an important game but had taken the news “like a real pro”.
“He’s a real competitor and he’ll take this opportunity to get himself back into form,” he said.
Camporeale said the Crows had trained “unbelievably well” during the week and were well prepared to beat the odds and cause a Showdown boilover.
